full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 70 of 247 198 LBUCmax3 Visoski - cross 1 A. That's correct. 2 Q. So you would have to walk through at least that first cabin of passengers? 3 A. That's correct. 4 Q. And on those trips you took to get coffee in the galley kitchen, you never saw any sexual activity going on then, did you? 5 A. No, never. 6 Q. Now, after the flight landed, I believe it was part of the pilot's job to help clean up the cabin and straighten up a bit; isn't that right? 7 A. Yes, it is. 8 Q. And when you did that, you never saw anything like clothes strewn about the cabin; is that right? 9 A. No, never. 10 Q. You never saw any sex toys left in the cabin? 11 A. Never. 12 Q. You never saw anything like used condoms? 13 A. Absolutely not. 14 Q. You never saw anything that gave you the impression that any kind of sexual activity was taking place on the plane with anyone; is that right? 15 A. That is correct, I never, no. 16 Q. So sitting here today, based on what you observed, you have no reason to believe that Epstein or anyone else was engaging SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017432
